MPC

Class MPCStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • java.io.PrintStream
          • MPC.MPCStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class MPCStream
extends java.io.PrintStream
    Adds indentation support to a PrintStream; helpful for nicely formatted AST output, etc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int indent
      indentation, express as number of columns of spaces to print when requested to do so
      static int indentStep
      the amount, in columns, by which to increase/decrease indentation when we change by one indentation step
      java.lang.String name
      The name of the file associated with this MPCStream, if any.
      static MPCStream Null
      Handy for directing output to nowhere

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.FilterOutputStream

        out

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MPCStream(java.io.OutputStream os)
      builds an MPCStream given an underlying OutputStream
      MPCStream(java.io.OutputStream os, java.lang.String nm)
      builds an MPCStream given an underlying OutputStream
      MPCStream(java.lang.String nm)
      as a convenience, will build an MPCStream given a filename

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MPCStream getNull() 
      void printFinish()
      finish a construct by print a close parenthesis and decreasing indentation by one step.
      void printIndent()
      concludes the current output line and prints spaces to indent the next line
      void printStart(java.lang.String s)
      for starting to print an indented/nested construct; outputs an open parenthesis, then the given String, then increases indentation by one step.

      • MPCStream

        public MPCStream(java.lang.String nm)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        as a convenience, will build an MPCStream given a filename
        Parameters:
        nm - the name of the file to open
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when nm cannot be opened for output
